channel.title: CVE Feed for Unknown -- ContentLock
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Unknown -- ContentLock

item.title: CVE-2024-6022|2024-07-16T18:01:53.746Z -- unknown -- contentlock
item.description: The ContentLock WordPress plugin through 1.0.3 does not have CSRF check in place when updating its settings, which could allow attackers to make a logged in admin change them via a CSRF attack

item.title: CVE-2024-6024|2024-07-12T14:24:45.218Z -- unknown -- contentlock
item.description: The ContentLock WordPress plugin through 1.0.3 does not have CSRF check in place when deleting groups or emails, which could allow attackers to make a logged in admin remove them via a CSRF attack

item.title: CVE-2024-6023|2024-07-12T06:00:06.958Z -- unknown -- contentlock
item.description: The ContentLock WordPress plugin through 1.0.3 does not have CSRF check in place when adding emails, which could allow attackers to make a logged in admin perform such action via a CSRF attack

item.title: CVE-2024-6022|2024-07-12T06:00:06.639Z -- unknown -- contentlock
item.description: The ContentLock WordPress plugin through 1.0.3 does not have CSRF check in place when updating its settings, which could allow attackers to make a logged in admin change them via a CSRF attack

item.title: CVE-2024-6024|2024-07-12T06:00:07.258Z -- unknown -- contentlock
item.description: The ContentLock WordPress plugin through 1.0.3 does not have CSRF check in place when deleting groups or emails, which could allow attackers to make a logged in admin remove them via a CSRF attack

item.title: CVE-2024-6023|2024-07-12T15:25:26.310Z -- unknown -- contentlock
item.description: The ContentLock WordPress plugin through 1.0.3 does not have CSRF check in place when adding emails, which could allow attackers to make a logged in admin perform such action via a CSRF attack
